member.name: P:DevExpress.XtraVerticalGrid.Rows.BaseRow.XtraRowTypeID

summary.para: Gets a value indicating the row's type.

member.value: An integer value representing the row's type identifier.

summary.para: Contains values specifying the type of item cell separators.
Specifies that cell separators have a custom string representation defined by the property. In this case the Separator style is used to control the look and feel of separator elements.

Specifies that a cell separator is displayed as a vertical line. The separator style is specified by the VertLine style, which affects the look and feel of all vertical lines within your grid control.
Lists values specifying the sort orders.
Reserved for future use. Sorts row cells in ascending order.
Reserved for future use. Sorts row cells in descending order.
Reserved for future use. Cancels the sorting applied.
Lists values specifying which row's functionality aspects are available to end users.
Reserved for future use.
If active, end users can move focus to the row using the mouse or keyboard. Otherwise, the row can not be focused either by the end users or via code.

If active and the control's option is enabled, end users can drag the row's header. Headers can be dragged to a new position within the vertical grid control to reorder rows or to the customization form to hide rows. Note that row headers can be dragged regardless of these options' states if the customization form is shown.
If active, users can drag row headers to the customization form. Otherwise the row can be hidden only via code by setting its property to false.

If active and the control's option is enabled, end users can change the row's height by dragging its header's bottom edge. Note that the row's height cannot be set to a value less than that specified by the row's property.
Reserved for future use.
If active, the parent row can be expanded by double clicking its header.
If active, this disables all other options.
If active, the row's header is displayed within the customization form when the row is hidden (its property is set to false).
Contains values specifying filtering types.
Indicates that filtering is applied based on a custom filter string. The string should be constructed in compliance with SQL requirements.
Indicates that filtering is disabled.
Indicates that a column should be filtered by a specific value.
Serves as the base for classes providing data for all row handling events.

Contains values that specify the painting style applied to the XtraVerticalGrid control.
Applies the DotNet painting style to your control.
Applies the 3D painting style to your control.

Lists the values used to identify the grid element located under a specific point or this point's position relative to the control.
A point belongs to the band edge, which is the right edge of the leftmost visible record. End users can drag this edge to resize records.
A point belongs to the border of the vertical grid control.
A point belongs to the client region of the Customization Form.
A point belongs to an empty client area of the vertical grid control.
A point belongs to the expand button residing within a parent row. Note that category rows can display two types of expand buttons, the button type depends on the control's look and feel settings.
A point belongs to the grip of the vertical grid control. The grip place is visible if both the vertical and horizontal scroll bars are visible.
A point belongs to a row header panel cell.
Reserved for future use.
A point belongs to the row header image displayed within a row header cell.
Reserved for future use.
A point belongs to the header separator, which is a vertical line between row headers and value cells. It can be dragged to resize row header width.
A point belongs to the grid's horizontal scroll bar.

A point belongs to a separator that divides cells in multi-editors rows. The separator is either a vertical line or a specific string between cells located within a combined row header (or value) cell. The separator can be dragged to resize the widths of inner cells for the multi-editor row.

A point does not belong to any defined part of the vertical grid control. More precisely, it resides outside the grid control within the region which cannot be specified by any member of the enumerator.

A point resides outside the grid control. It is located below the grid but is still within its width. This can be used for handling a dragging operation initiated within the XtraVerticalGrid control when it is necessary to determine the direction of dragging.

A point resides outside the grid control. It is located to the left of the grid's left edge but is still within its height boundaries. This can be used for handling a dragging operation initiated within the XtraVerticalGrid control when it is necessary to determine the direction of dragging.

A point resides outside the grid control. It is located to the right of the grid's right edge but is still within its height boundaries. This can be used for handling a dragging operation initiated within the XtraVerticalGrid control when it is necessary to determine the direction of dragging.

A point resides outside the grid control. It is located above the grid but is still within its width. This can be used for handling a dragging operation initiated within the XtraVerticalGrid control when it is necessary to determine the direction of dragging.
A point belongs to the right edge of the leftmost visible column representing a record. It can be dragged to resize the width of all records.

A point belongs to a row. Such an area corresponds to the following elements: empty spaces followed by captions within header cells, horizontal and vertical lines between cells in adjacent rows, horizontal and vertical bars representing categories.
A point belongs to a row edge. A row edge is the bottom edge of the row's header cell. It can be dragged to resize row height.
A point belongs to a value cell.
A point belongs to the grid's vertical scroll bar.
Contains values that specify the XtraVerticalGrid control's behavior.
If active, a newly added record is automatically focused.

para.para: If active, when a cell editor is activated the entire contents of the cell are selected. Otherwise, when a cell editor becomes active the cursor is positioned before the first character of the cell's value.
Note that when this option is enabled, the left and right arrow keys cannot be used to move the cursor within a cell. These keys are instead used only to navigate between records.
If active, row dragging is allowed. Note however that the row's option must also be enabled to allow this row to be dragged. Row options are available via the property of rows.
Please refer to the Using Drag-and-Drop topic of the End User Capabilities section for details on row dragging.
If active, end users are allowed to invoke cell editors.

Note that you can also prohibit invoking cell editors for a specific row by setting its property to false. If you need to prevent the editing of a specific row item's values, set its property to true.

summary.para: When enabled, all other options become disabled. If this option is disabled, all other options are again enabled.
If active, child rows remain hidden if their parent row is moved from the customization form using drag and drop.

para.para: If active, end users can use the mouse wheel to scroll through:

item.term: records, if the single record view or multiple records view layout is applied to the control;
bands, if the bands view layout is applied to the control.

para.para: If active, end users can change the row header panel's width by dragging the row header's right edge. The width of the row header panel can also be changed using CTRL-LEFT and CTRL-RIGHT key combinations. In this case, the number of pixels by which the width changes is specified by the property.
Note that the width of the row header panel can be changed via code regardless of this option's state. Use the property for this purpose.
If active, end users can change the height of each row by dragging the row header's bottom edge.
Note that the height of individual rows can be changed via code regardless of this option's state. Use the row's property for this purpose.
If active, end users can change the width of records by dragging the record edge (the band edge, if the bands view layout is currently applied).
Note that record width can be changed via code regardless of whether this option is enabled. The property can be used for this purpose.
If active, expanding a parent row forces the XtraVerticalGrid control to scroll the view to make the maximum number of child rows visible.

summary.para: If active, pressing the ENTER key automatically hides the currently active cell's editor saving the changes made to its content and moves focus to the next row cell activating its editor. A row's cells cannot be focused if its option is disabled.
If active, the TAB/SHIFT+TAB key combinations move focus to the next/previous row (row item).
Represents a method that will handle the event.

summary.para: Contains values that specify the source of a row drag operation.
Indicates that a drag operation starts within the vertical grid control.
Indicates that a drag operation starts within the customization form.
Contains values indicating all the available states for the vertical grid.
A vertical grid is being disposed of.
A cell editor is currently active.
The focused row has changed.

A row header panel's right edge is being dragged to change the row header's width. The width of the row header panel can also be changed using the CTRL-LEFT and CTRL-RIGHT key combinations. The control's option must be enabled to allow such resizing.
A multi editor row cell's separator is being dragged by the end user. This action results in changing cell width.
A record's right edge is being dragged to change record width. The control's option must be enabled to allow such resizing.
The control is in its normal state. No specific action is being performed by the end user.

A row's header is being dragged. The desired row's and the control's options must both be enabled to allow row header dragging. Note that the user can drag row headers regardless of these options' states if the customization form is shown.
A row header's bottom edge is being dragged to change row height. The desired row's and control's options must both be enabled to allow such resizing operations.
Lists values specifying the availability of control's elements that enable data scrolling.
The scrolling element is visible only when data scrolling can be performed.
Horizontal and vertical scrolling elements are always visible.
The scrolling element is only visible when horizontal scrolling can be performed. The vertical scroll bar is invisible in this case.
The scrolling element is invisible regardless of whether data scrolling can be performed.
The scrolling element is only visible when vertical scrolling can be performed. The horizontal scroll bar is invisible in this case.
Provides common data for native drag-specific events of the XtraVerticalGrid control.
